disclosure:
CFTC How it Works Disclosures: Producer Swap: Above the swap value, customer pays Cargill. Below the swap value, Cargill pays customer. Consumer Swap: Above the swap value, Cargill pays customer. Below the swap value, customer pays Cargill.

Acceptance of this offer and the subsequent Posted Positions shall constitute an Acknowledgment and Confirmation for this Transaction under applicable law, including the U.S. Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and accompanying regulations.
description:
Producer swaps can be initiated by using either a market order or a limit order. The fixed price of the swap is determined by the underlying commodity market, contract month and year.

This is how a producer swap works: When the position is closed, if the corresponding market is above the fixed price, a customer pays Cargill the difference between the market and the fixed price. If the corresponding market is below the fixed price, Cargill pays the customer the difference between the fixed price and the market.

Benefit of using a Producer Swap:  A producer swap is a 'show swap' that allows the user to product again declining prices. A producer swap also provides unlimited flexibility and control by allowing the user to protect market prices independently of the cash market; so, basis decisions can be optimized. The user remains in control by deciding when to enter or exit the swap position.

terms.description: A market order is a sell (buy) order to be executed at the current market prices, as long as there are willing buyers (sellers) and the order is placed during the trading session. Market orders are filled at-the-market under normal market conditions. Orders can be placed anytime; however, orders will only be executed during market hours (Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 1:15 p.m. and Sunday through Thursday from 7:30 p.m. to 7:45 a.m. all times CST).

A limit order is an order to sell (buy) a commodity at a specified price or better. Orders can be placed anytime; however, orders will only be executed during market hours (Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 1:15 p.m. and Sunday through Thursday from 7:30 p.m. to 7:45 a.m. all times CST).
